widgets_values: Optional -  you can extend your initial generation by more frames, and continue chaining longer generations by duplicating the LTXV Extend Sampler node and connecting the Latents.
You can generate up to 257 frames if you have enough VRAM.

This node emulates cinematic film grain.
Recommended settings:
grain_intensity: 0.03
saturation: 0.00
Optional -  you can extend your initial generation by more frames, and continue chaining longer generations by duplicating the LTXV Extend Sampler node and connecting the Latents.

Framerate can be adjusted, just make sure you are using the same framerate in your VideoCombine node to see proper playback.

60FPS = Lower quality, more motion
24 FPS = Higher quality, less motion

We generate at a base resolution of 768x512.
The video will be upscaled later to FHD.

Overlap decides how many of the last frames in the input video are used to condition the new video generation. The total number of frames generated is frame_overlap + num_new_frames, and then the new video and the previous video are fused by this node and the full extended video is returned.

Overlap decides how many of the last frames in the input video are used to condition the new video generation. The total number of frames generated is frame_overlap + num_new_frames, and then the new video and the previous video are fused by this node and the full extended video is returned.

nodes.title: CLIP Text Encode (Negative Prompt)
widgets_values: low quality, worst quality, deformed, distorted, disfigured, motion smear, motion artifacts, fused fingers, bad anatomy, weird hand, ugly

If you are not constrained in VRAM, run 1x1 tile starting from step 19 
If you are constrained in your available VRAM, run 3x3 tiles and use somewhat lower noies levels, starting from step 23.
Higher STG and CFG will increase local contrast, but excess can create overbaking artifacts

This node emulates cinematic film grain.
Recommended settings:
grain_intensity: 0.03
saturation: 0.00

You can skip the first LTXV upscale pass and go straight to GAN upsampler, just change the switch output.
Option 1: i2v base result
Option 2: extended i2v result
Option 3: extended+upscaled result
To upscale the "Extended" video result, change the switch to '2'

The Advanced STG Guider dynamically controls the diffusion model's denoising process by mapping sigma values to specific configuration parameters (CFG scale, STG scale/rescale factors, and attention layer skipping patterns), enabling precise control at different denoising stages independently of step numbers while supporting additional techniques like CFG-Zero rescaling and threshold-based noise prediction zeroing.

crop decides if the conditioning image(s) is center-cropped or resized by stretching 

crf and blur are preprocessing parameters for conditioning image(s) to make them look more like video frames, which helps with the dynamicity of the generated video
Presets override the values inside 🅛🅣🅧 STG Guider Advanced node.

nodes.title: Custom Prompt (TextMultiline)
widgets_values: woman walking on the beach holding a spear

You can either use LTXV prompt enhancer node to generate an LLM based prompt, or manually type in your prompt.

Ideally, try to be descriptive and have longer prompts, describing the subject, setting, lighting conditions, action, camera movement and visual style. You can also leave the prompt blank and get surprising results.

Option 1 - Manual prompt (no LLM enhancement)
Option 2 - LTXV Prompt Enhancer
Depending on the latent upscaler model used, it can increase either spatial or temporal resolution, without moving to/from pixel space.
